data.text: Write a Python script to create a variable named `house` and assign it the value 'Gryffindor'. Then print out the value of the variable.
The following code has a mistake. Identify and correct the error so that it runs without errors.
Create a variable called `wizard` and assign it the value 'Harry'. Then reassign the variable to a number representing Harry's age, 11. Print the variable each time after assignment.
Using a single line of code, assign the value 'Hogwarts' to three variables: `school1`, `school2`, and `school3`. Print each variable on a new line.
Assign the string 'Hermione', the integer 12, and the float 4.5 to the variables `name`, `age`, and `score` respectively, using a single line of code. Print each variable to verify their values.

Write a function `potions_class()` that declares a local variable `subject` as 'Potions'. Also have a global variable `subject` with the value 'Defense Against the Dark Arts'. Inside the function, print the local `subject`. Outside the function, print the global `subject`.

lessonName: Complex Task: Text Analysis with Variables

data.text: Create a script that assigns a paragraph from any Harry Potter book to a variable `text`. Then, using variables, count and print the number of times the word 'magic' appears in the text. You may not use any built-in string methods other than basic iteration, indexing, and length checking.
